questions.question: Which 1978 film starring John Travolta and Olivia Newton-John became an iconic musical representation of high school life in the 1950s?
What was the name of the handheld electronic game, introduced by Nintendo in 1980, that became a huge hit, allowing players to control falling blocks?
Who was the British Prime Minister throughout most of the 1980s, becoming the longest-serving British prime minister of the 20th century?
Which of the following arcade video games was released first?
Who sang the 1983 hit song 'Flashdance... What a Feeling'?
Which character was the leader of the Autobots in the original 1980s 'Transformers' animated series?
What was the name of the music device introduced by Sony in 1979 that revolutionized how people listened to music on the go?
What was the name of the dance craze that took the world by storm after being featured in Michael Jackson's music video for 'Thriller'?
Which movie released in 1977 became a cornerstone of science fiction and spawned a massive franchise that includes movies, TV shows, and merchandise?
incorrectAnswers: Close Encounters of the Third Kind

questions.question: What arcade game, released in 1980, was a pioneer in the maze chase genre, featuring a character that eats dots while avoiding ghosts?
Who sang the hit song 'Like a Virgin', which became a global anthem in the mid-1980s?
Which toy line, featuring robots that could transform into vehicles, became a huge hit in the 1980s?
What was the first 24-hour cable news network, launched in 1980?
Which 1980s sitcom featured a family who adopted an alien from the planet Melmac?
What was the name of the popular toy line featuring small, colorful bears with symbols on their bellies?
